1.q_string:
Potassium chlorate is prepared by electrolysis of \(\mathrm{KCl}\) in basic solution as shown by following equation.

\(6 \mathrm{OH}^{-}+\mathrm{Cl}^{-} \rightarrow \mathrm{ClO}_3^{-}+3 \mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}+6 e^{-}\)

A current of \(x \mathrm{~A}\) has to be passed for \(10 \mathrm{~h}\) to produce \(10.0 \mathrm{~g}\) of potassium chlorate. the value of \(x\) is (Nearest integer)

(Molar mass of \(\mathrm{KClO}_3=122.6 \mathrm{~g} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}, \mathrm{~F}=96500 \mathrm{C}\) )

[20 Jul 2021 Shift 2]

A \(5.0 \mathrm{mmol} \mathrm{d \textrm {m } ^ { - 3 }}\) aqueous solution of \(\mathrm{KCl}\) has a conductance of \(0.55 \mathrm{mS}\) when measured in a cell constant \(1.3 \mathrm{~cm}^{-1}\).

The molar conductivity of this solution is \(\mathrm{mSm}^2 \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}\).

(Round off to the nearest integer)
